questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Apple, Banana, Mango, Potato
questions.explanation: Apple, Banana, and Mango are fruits. Potato is a vegetable. Therefore, Potato is the odd one out.
2, 3, and 5 are prime numbers. 9 is a composite number (9 = 3 × 3). Therefore, 9 is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: A, E, I, P
questions.explanation: A, E, and I are vowels. P is a consonant. Therefore, P is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Lion, Tiger, Leopard, Cow
questions.explanation: Lion, Tiger, and Leopard are carnivorous wild animals. Cow is a herbivorous domestic animal. Therefore, Cow is the odd one out.
4 (2²), 9 (3²), and 16 (4²) are perfect squares. 20 is not a perfect square. Therefore, 20 is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Rose, Jasmine, Lotus, Mango
questions.explanation: Rose, Jasmine, and Lotus are flowers. Mango is a fruit tree. Therefore, Mango is the odd one out.
5, 10, and 15 are multiples of 5. 22 is not a multiple of 5. Therefore, 22 is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: B, D, F, I
questions.explanation: B(2), D(4), F(6) are at even positions in the alphabet. I(9) is at an odd position. Therefore, I is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Gold, Silver, Copper, Steel
questions.explanation: Gold, Silver, and Copper are pure metals. Steel is an alloy (iron + carbon). Therefore, Steel is the odd one out.
8 (2³), 27 (3³), and 64 (4³) are perfect cubes. 100 is not a perfect cube. Therefore, 100 is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Pen, Pencil, Eraser, Chalk
questions.explanation: Pen, Pencil, and Chalk are used for writing. Eraser is used to remove writing. Therefore, Eraser is the odd one out.
12, 18, and 24 are divisible by 6. 35 is not divisible by 6. Therefore, 35 is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: M, N, O, Q
questions.explanation: M, N, O are consecutive letters in the alphabet. Q breaks the sequence (should be P). Therefore, Q is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Doctor, Teacher, Engineer, Hospital
questions.explanation: Doctor, Teacher, and Engineer are professions. Hospital is a place. Therefore, Hospital is the odd one out.
2, 4, and 6 are even numbers. 9 is an odd number. Therefore, 9 is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Kilometer, Meter, Centimeter, Liter
questions.explanation: Kilometer, Meter, and Centimeter are units of length/distance. Liter is a unit of volume. Therefore, Liter is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: C, F, I, M
questions.explanation: C(3), F(6), I(9) follow a +3 pattern in positions. M(13) breaks the pattern (should be L at position 12). Therefore, M is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Cricket
questions.explanation: Physics, Chemistry, and Biology are science subjects. Cricket is a sport. Therefore, Cricket is the odd one out.
